Traintastic server is running in the background.

The %command_station% setup is now ready, you can bring it online by using the connect option on the toolbar.

If you need to make additional changes you can find the interface via the menu: Object → Hardware → Interfaces.
Enter the IP address of the %command_station% to connect to:
Enter the IP address and port number of the %command_station% to connect to:
Please select the LocoNet interface that is connected to the %command_station%:
Please select the XpressNet interface that is connected to the %command_station%:
Enter a name for the connection:
Please select the communication protocol for the connection:
The %command_station% supports two different protocols for communication. Although both are supported by Traintastic, using LocoNet is recommended as it is more versatile.
Select the serial port where the %command_station% is connected to:
Select the serial port where the %interface% is connected to:

This wizard will guide you to the interface setup process.

If you're running Traintastic server and Traintastic client on seperate PC's, make sure the command station is connected to the PC running Traintastic server.

Traintastic has two modes of operation:
• Edit mode
• Operation mode

In operation mode only operating the layout is possible to prevent making accidential changes. e.g. to change a turnout address or modify the layout edit mode must be active.

Switching between operation and edit mode can be done using the pencil icon right on the main toolbar or via the main menu: World → Edit world.
If you have any questions or suggestion please join the Traintastic forum.

This wizard will explain Traintastic's basics. The next pages will help to get you started. If you want to view this wizard again, you can open it via the main menu: Help → Wizard → Traintastic introduction.

The world contains everything that is on the layout, like the command station, trains, signals, turnouts etc. If required multiple worlds can be created but only one can be in use at any time.

Worlds are saved on the PC running the Traintastic server. When saving a world a backup is automatically created. Via the main menu: File → Export world option it is possible to get a copy of the world as additional backup or to transfer it to another Traintastic server.

Adding new elements to the board can be done using the items available in serveral menu's. Use mouse left click to place an element, use mouse right click to rotate an element.

To replace an element with another element hold ctrl while left clicking, otherwise the old element must be deleted first.
The board can only be modified if the world is in edit mode and is stopped. The toolbar with edit option will automatically appear when editing is possible.
This wizard will explain the basics of the board.
This wizard will help to set the basic board properties.
Give the board a name, e.g. Traintastic, Station Awesome or Staging area:
Basic world properties are now set, you can always change them later via the menu: World -> Properties.
This wizard will guide you to setup the basic world properties.
Give the world a name, this name will be visible when loading a world.
Select the world scale, Traintastic will use this for distance and speed calcualtions.
Try to correct ouput state when externally changed while locked
Use short emergency stop locomotive command
